intro: Gaultheria colensoi, commonly known as the Colenso's wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are red when ripe, containing a high concentration of aromatic oils. Gaultheria colensoi thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important plant in its native habitat.
